prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: Mia's little sister. Currently training to become a spirit medium.
Character 1
Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: A gifted prosecutor, and a ruthless man who'd do anything to get a "guilty" verdict.
Character 2
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 3
Name: Will Powers
Description: The defendant. Action star who plays the title role in "The Steel Samurai" TV Show.
Character 4
Name: Security Lady
Description: Security guard at Global Studios. Claims she saw Powers heading to the scene.
Character 5
Name: Jack Hammer
Description: The victim. A former big name action star. Played the role of the Evil Magistrate.
Character 6
Name: Assistant
Description: Name: Penny Nichols. Assistant at Global Studios in charge of large props and set pieces.
Character 7
Name: The Director
Description: Name: Sal Manella. Creator of "The Steel Samurai." Present on the day of the crime.
Character 8
Name: Cody Hackins
Description: A big fan of the Steel Samurai. Present at the studio on the day of the crime.
Character 9
Name: Dee Vasquez
Description: High-ranking producer at Global Studios. Present on the day of the crime.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: No one would believe I was a defense attorney if I didn't carry this.
Evidence 1
Name: Powers's Letter
Description: Document proving Will Powers's request for an attorney.
Evidence 2
Name: Guidemap
Description: Guidemap to Global Studios. Click here for details.
Evidence 3
Name: Jack's Autopsy Report
Description: Time of death: 10/15 at 2:30 PM. Cause: Pierced through the chest by a spear.
Evidence 4
Name: Cardkey
Description: Cardkey for Studio Employees. Grants access into Studio One.
Evidence 5
Name: Powers'(?) Photo
Description: Taken at the gate between the entrance and the Studios. [Oct 15, 2:00 PM, Photo #2] [caption] Steel Samurai is seen walking. He's dragging one leg. Click here for details. [Oct 15, 2:00 PM, Photo #2]
Will:
No, it's okay. This is the real me. When I got the part of the Steel Samurai, with that mask...
Evidence 6
Name: Samurai Spear
Description: This spear was found stuck in the chest of the victim. The murder weapon. A break in the shaft has been mended with duct tape.
Evidence 7
Name: Empty Bottle → Sleeping Pill Bottle
Description: Found on a table in the employee area. The label reads "Sleeping Pills." Found on a table in the employee area. Bears Jack Hammer's fingerprints.
Evidence 8
Name: Trailer Key
Description: The key tag reads "Studio Two Trailer".
Evidence 9
Name: Vasquez's Memo
Description: The memo read "Bring me the script from Episode 13".
Evidence 10
Name: Script
Description: A Steel Samurai script. The cover reads "Episode 13".
Evidence 11
Name: Mr. Monkey's Head
Description: Blocked the path to the scene of the crime between 2:15 PM and 4:00 PM.
Evidence 12
Name: Steel Samurai Card
Description: A trading card. Apparently, these are really popular with kids these days.
Evidence 13
Name: URP Card
Description: An "Ultra Rare Premium" Steel Samurai collectible card. Very valuable.
Evidence 14
Name: "Path to Glory"
Description: Contains photos of every victory scene in every battle the Steel Samurai has won.
Evidence 15
Name: Cody's Camera
Description: A new digital camera. Cody always carries it, though he's still learning how to use it.
Evidence 16
Name: Steak Plate
Description: Found in the employee area. On it are traces of sleeping pills and a large bone.
Evidence 17
Name: Five-Year-Old Photo
Description: Shows an accident involving Jack Hammer. Click here for details.
Evidence 18
Name: Van
Description: Manella used this van to drive Vasquez to Studio One after the meeting in the trailer.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: On the day of the murder, I arrived at the guard station at 1:00 PM.
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 1
Testimony: Poor old Hammer and the rest had been doing a run-through there since the morning.
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 2
Testimony: I, well, I had some errands to run that morning.
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 3
Testimony: Anyway, it was 1:00 when I got to the guard station.
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 4
Testimony: I was at the main gate from then until 5:00!
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 5
Testimony: Now, the murder happened at 2:30 PM, right?
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 6
Testimony: Interesting to me, because a certain man walked right by me at 2:00 PM.
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 7
Testimony: It was Powers! That man right there, and he was heading toward the studio!
Person: Oldbag

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's see. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. Let's start by reviewing the given information.

The characters include the Security Lady (Character 4), who claims she saw Powers heading to the scene. The testimonies from Oldbag (Security Lady) include several statements. Testimony 3 says she got to the guard station at 1:00 PM. Testimony 4 claims she was at the main gate from 1:00 PM until 5:00 PM. Then, in Testimony 6 and 7, she says that at 2:00 PM, she saw Powers walking towards the studio.

Looking at the evidence, Evidence 5 is the photo taken at 2:00 PM showing the Steel Samurai (who is Powers) dragging one leg. The photo is at the gate between the entrance and the studios. The Security Lady (Oldbag) claims she saw Powers at 2:00 PM. But if the Steel Samurai in the photo is Powers, and he was at the gate at 2:00 PM, then her testimony might conflict with something else.

Wait, but the Security Lady's testimony says she was at the main gate from 1:00 to 5:00 PM. The photo is taken at the gate between entrance and studios. If she was at the main gate, she should have seen Powers. However, the Steel Samurai in the photo is dragging a leg. But the real Steel Samurai costume might not have a leg injury. Maybe the person in the costume isn't Powers? Or perhaps the timing contradicts the blocked path.

Wait, another evidence is Evidence 11: Mr. Monkey's Head blocked the path from 2:15 PM to 4:00 PM. So if the path was blocked after 2:15 PM, then how could Powers go to the studio at 2:00 PM? Wait, the murder happened at 2:30 PM. The Security Lady says she saw Powers at 2:00 PM heading to the studio, which is the crime scene. But if the path was blocked starting at 2:15 PM, then after that, no one could get through. But the murder happened at 2:30 PM. So if the path was blocked from 2:15 PM, then the killer must have entered before 2:15 PM, which aligns with Powers being seen at 2:00 PM. Hmm, maybe that's not a contradiction.

Wait, but the Security Lady's testimony (Testimony 7) says she saw Powers at 2:00 PM heading towards the studio. But the photo (Evidence 5) shows the Steel Samurai (presumed to be Powers) at the gate at 2:00 PM. However, if the path was blocked by the Mr. Monkey's Head from 2:15 PM onwards, then after 2:15, Powers couldn't have returned. But the murder was at 2:30 PM. So if Powers went in at 2:00 PM, he would be there when the path was blocked. But how does that contradict?

Alternatively, maybe the Security Lady's claim that she was at the main gate the entire time (Testimony 4) contradicts with the photo. Wait, the photo is taken at the gate between entrance and studios. If she was at the main gate, then the photo would be from that location. But according to her testimony, she was there all the time and saw Powers at 2:00 PM. But the photo shows the Steel Samurai (Powers) at 2:00 PM. That doesn't contradict; maybe the contradiction is elsewhere.

Wait, the Steel Samurai in the photo is dragging a leg. Maybe Powers wasn't injured, so the person in the costume isn't him. The real Powers might have an alibi. Or perhaps the time of the photo contradicts another testimony. Alternatively, the Security Lady's testimony that she saw Powers at 2:00 PM heading to the studio (Testimony 7) and the photo (Evidence 5) showing the Steel Samurai (with a dragging leg) at 2:00 PM. But if the Steel Samurai is Powers, then the dragging leg might indicate an injury. However, Powers plays the Steel Samurai, which has a specific costume. If in the photo, the leg is dragging, but Powers in reality doesn't have a leg injury, that could suggest someone else was in the costume. But how does that relate to the testimonies?

Wait, the Security Lady (Oldbag) in Testimony 7 claims she saw Powers at 2:00 PM heading to the studio. However, the photo (Evidence 5) taken at the same time shows the Steel Samurai (who is supposed to be Powers) at the gate. If the Steel Samurai in the photo is at the gate, but the Security Lady was at the main gate, then perhaps the path from the main gate to the studio would require passing through that area. However, if the Security Lady was at the main gate, and the photo shows the Steel Samurai entering or exiting, but she claims to have seen Powers (not in costume?), there's a contradiction. Wait, no—the Security Lady says she saw Powers himself, not in costume. But the photo shows the Steel Samurai in costume. So if Powers was in the studio in costume at 2:00 PM, but the Security Lady saw him outside the studio, that's a contradiction. Wait, but maybe the Steel Samurai in the photo is not Powers. Because the photo's caption says "Steel Samurai is seen walking. He's dragging one leg." But Powers, as the actor, would walk normally in the costume. So if the photo shows someone dragging a leg, perhaps it's not Powers but someone else, implying that Powers was elsewhere, contradicting the Security Lady's testimony that she saw him. Therefore, the Security Lady's Testimony 7 (saying she saw Powers at 2:00 PM) contradicts Evidence 5 (the photo showing the Steel Samurai at the same time, implying that Powers was in costume and thus the person in the costume is him, but the dragging leg suggests otherwise, meaning it's not him, so Security Lady is lying or mistaken). Alternatively, if the photo is taken at 2:00 PM at the gate, and the Security Lady was at the main gate all the time, then the Steel Samurai in the photo would have passed by her. But she claims she saw Powers, not the Steel Samurai. So that would be a contradiction. For example, if she saw Powers in person (not in costume), but the photo shows the Steel Samurai (in costume) at the same time, then Powers couldn't be in two places at once. Wait, but the Steel Samurai is a character played by Powers. So if the photo shows the Steel Samurai at 2:00 PM at the gate, that would mean Powers was in costume there. But the Security Lady claims she saw Powers (the person, not in costume) heading to the studio. That's impossible if he was in costume at the gate. Therefore, Testimony 7 (Security Lady saw Powers at 2:00 PM) contradicts Evidence 5 (showing the Steel Samurai, which is Powers in costume, at the same time). So she couldn't have seen Powers out of costume if he was in costume in the photo. Therefore, the contradiction is between Testimony 7 (Security Lady saying she saw Powers at 2:00 PM) and Evidence 5 (photo showing the Steel Samurai at 2:00 PM, implying Powers was in costume and thus not as himself). Therefore, the pair would be Evidence 5 and Testimony 7. But the question says to answer with one pair. Wait, looking at the evidence numbers, Evidence 5 is "Powers'(?) Photo" with the Steel Samurai at 2:00 PM. Testimony 7 is Oldbag saying she saw Powers (as himself) at 2:00 PM. Therefore, the contradiction is that if the photo shows Powers in costume at the gate at 2:00 PM, he couldn't have been seen by the Security Lady as himself outside the costume. Therefore, the evidence and testimony that contradict are Evidence 5 and Testimony 7. But wait, the Security Lady's Testimony 7 is "It was Powers! That man right there, and he was heading toward the studio!" So she's claiming she saw Powers (the person) at 2:00 PM, but the photo shows the Steel Samurai (implying Powers in costume) at the same time. If Powers was in costume, then the Security Lady would have seen the Steel Samurai, not Powers himself. Therefore, her testimony contradicts the photo evidence. So the correct pair is evidence 5 and testimony 7.

cot:
Okay, let's see. I need to find which evidence contradicts one of the testimonies. The testimonies given are from Oldbag (Security Lady, Character 4). She says that the only person she saw going to the studio before 2:30 PM was Will Powers, and no one else, and she would have seen them.

Looking at the evidence, let's check each one. Evidence 5 is Powers'(?) Photo, taken at the gate at 2:00 PM. The photo shows the Steel Samurai dragging one leg. But according to Oldbag's testimony, she only saw Powers. But maybe the person in the photo isn't Powers? Wait, Powers plays the Steel Samurai, right? But if the Steel Samurai in the photo is dragging a leg, maybe that's not Powers. Because if Powers was in the costume, maybe he wouldn't drag his leg. Or perhaps someone else was wearing the costume. For instance, the victim, Jack Hammer, played the Evil Magistrate. But maybe another character? Or someone else.

Also, there's the Empty Bottle (Evidence 7) with Jack's fingerprints, and the Steak Plate (Evidence 16) with sleeping pills. But how does that relate to the testimony? The photo might be key here. The Security Lady claims she saw Powers going to the scene, but the photo at 2:00 PM shows the Steel Samurai (which is Powers' role) walking, but dragging a leg. If Powers was the one in the costume, maybe he had an injury, but if not, then maybe someone else was in the costume. If the photo was taken at 2:00 PM and the murder happened at 2:30 PM, then the person in the costume could have been the killer. If Oldbag says she only saw Powers, but the photo shows the Steel Samurai (supposedly Powers) going in, but perhaps the real Powers was somewhere else, then there's a contradiction. Alternatively, maybe the Steel Samurai in the photo is someone else, which would mean Oldbag's testimony that she only saw Powers is false because she actually saw the Steel Samurai (who could be someone else). 

Wait, the photo is from 2:00 PM, and the murder was at 2:30. The Security Lady's testimony says she saw Powers going to the studio before then (2:30 PM). But the photo shows the Steel Samurai at 2:00 PM. If the Steel Samurai is Powers, then that aligns with her statement. However, if the person in the costume was someone else, then her statement that she only saw Powers is contradicted. So perhaps the photo shows that someone else was in the Steel Samurai costume. For example, the script (Evidence 10) might indicate that the Steel Samurai's movements are different. Or maybe the fact that the spear (Evidence 6) had a mended break with duct tape. Wait, the Samurai Spear's description mentions a break mended with duct tape. If the Steel Samurai's spear is supposed to be intact, but this one is broken, maybe the one used in the murder is a different one. Hmm. Alternatively, the photo shows the Steel Samurai dragging a leg, which might be a clue that the person inside the costume isn't Powers. Because if Powers normally doesn't drag his leg, then maybe it's someone else. If that's the case, then the Security Lady's testimony that she only saw Powers is contradicted by the photo, which actually shows someone else in the costume. So the contradiction would be between Testimony 2 ("No one else went there!") and Evidence 5, which shows the Steel Samurai (possibly not Powers) entering the studio. Therefore, the evidence (5) contradicts the testimony (Testimony 2 or 3). Let me check the testimonies again. Testimony 2: "No one else went there!" Testimony 3: "If they had, I would have seen them!" So the photo shows someone (Steel Samurai) going in, but if that's someone else, then Oldbag didn't see them, but the camera did. The camera automatically takes pictures when someone walks by. So if the camera captured the Steel Samurai at 2:00 PM, then Oldbag should have seen them. But she claims she didn't see anyone else. Therefore, the photo (Evidence 5) contradicts her Testimony 3 ("If they had, I would have seen them!") because the camera shows that someone (maybe not Powers) did go in, but she didn't report seeing anyone else. Therefore, the contradiction is between Evidence 5 and Testimony 3.
